Scenario:
1. Source has fields 1, 2 and 3 marked with @ordered
2. Target has fields 2 and 1 (in this order)

Problem:
In a first pass, JMerger will set the target to be 2, 3, 1 and in a second pass it  will sort it as specified in the target.  The AST facade implementation throws the following NPE when field 3 is removed by the sorting algorithm because LocationInParent is null for nodes that are added to a Compilation Unit.

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.dom.rewrite.RewriteEventStore.doMarkMovedAsRemoved(RewriteEventStore.java:775)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.dom.rewrite.RewriteEventStore.prepareSingleNodeCopies(RewriteEventStore.java:768)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.dom.rewrite.RewriteEventStore.prepareMovedNodes(RewriteEventStore.java:650)
at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.rewrite.ASTRewrite.internalRewriteAST(ASTRewrite.java:252)
at org.eclipse.jdt.core.dom.rewrite.ASTRewrite.rewriteAST(ASTRewrite.java:188)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.merge.java.facade.ast.ASTJCompilationUnit.getContents(ASTJCompilationUnit.java:258)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.merge.java.JMerger.getTargetCompilationUnitContents(JMerger.java:145)
at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.generator.AbstractGeneratorAdapter.generateJava(AbstractGeneratorAdapter.java:958)

The fix for the NPE is to check if astNode.getParent() and astNode.getLocationInParent() return a not null value in ASTJType.remove(JNode).

This would fix the problem if it was not for the issue described in the bigzilla 164862 (ASTRewriter doesn't allows a code to remove a node recently added to the tree).  As a workaround, we've extended the ASTRewriter to provide this feature.

The fix is committed to CVS.
